page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content: Yateley lies in the north-east corner of Hampshire where this county meets Berkshire and Surrey. The river Blackwater separates Yateley from Sandhurst and provides a boundary between Hampshire and Berkshire.There has been very rapid housing develop- ment in the last two decades,changing the character of the area from a village to a small town,with an estimated population of over 25,000. Good communication (easy access to motorways 3 and 4 and trains and buses) has inevitably led to the area becoming a dormitory town and a steady stream of traffic can be observed leaving Yateley every morning in the directions of London,Reading and Southampton.
